intro: Apteranthes europaea var. tristis, commonly known as the European thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands, wastelands, and disturbed soils. It has a taproot system and produces achenes as its seeds. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of study in plant ecology.
